p: The laboratory hamster model reproduces the features of human YF but requires the use of adapted strains ( Julander 2016). We recently implemented a hamster model for YFV, based on the use of a strain equivalent to the Asibi/hamster p7 strain described by McArthur etÂ al. (2003), Ap7M. When inoculated into hamsters, this strain induces a lethal viscerotropic disease similar to that described for YF Ap7 virus in terms of (1) clinical signs of illness, (2) weight evolution, (3) viral loads in the liver, and (iv) lethality (100 per cent). This strain was derived from Asibi by including ten mutations in the FI subgenomic region used for viral recovery with the ISA method. As we chose to target the FII subgenomic region for re-encoding, the Ap7M strain was well suited for testing the effects of re-encoding on the biological properties of viruses in vivo.
